section.para: JLM manufactures windows and doors for residential sale and is a SEC registrant that operates under a fiscal year-end of December 31. JLM has experienced a tremendous growth rate during the past 2 years. As a result, it has entered into an expansion and equipment upgrade project at its plant. In order to keep up with demands, JLM has increased its workforce by 25%.

On January 1, 20X1, JLM issued a 5-year, $1 million, BB-rated bond obligation. The interest rate on the bond obligation was fixed at 8%, payable on a quarterly basis. On February 1, 20X1, to hedge its exposure to changes in LIBOR (that is, the designated benchmark interest rate risk being hedged), JLM entered into a 5-year interest rate swap with a notional amount of $1 million to receive a fixed rate of 8% and pay a variable rate equal to 90-day LIBOR (at the end of each quarter) plus 2%, payable on a quarterly basis, with the first payment due March 31, 20X1.
